subject: Design
subcategory: Famous Logos and Their Hidden Stories
title: Tiffany Blue: Owning a Color
description: A micro-lesson that makes Tiffany Blue: Owning a Color usable.

hook.text: Tiffany & Co. doesn't just have a logo. They own a color. Pantone 1837 is legally theirs.

buildup.text: The robin's-egg blue was chosen in 1837 for the cover of Tiffany's annual catalog.

discovery.text: The color triggers an instant emotional response: luxury, elegance, a gift worth giving.

twist.text: You cannot use this exact shade of blue for jewelry packaging anywhere in the world. It's trademarked.

climax.text: Tiffany proved that brand identity can live in a single color â€” no words or shapes needed.

punchline.text: When you own a color, you own an emotion.

quiz.question: What is unique about Tiffany Blue?
